name: Kwilper
content:
Kwilper was a Squib trader. He left Skor II in search of the junk heap of the ancients. In the process, he discovered a talent: he could collect cast-off junk  and refashioned it into art. He earned a respectable profit due to the essentially non-existent overhead with regard to his art supplies. His personality was fairly normal for his species: overconfident, inquisitive, and annoying to others.
Kwilper carried a datapad, a multi-pocket toolbelt, and a blaster with several non-functioning modifications. He flew a Squib scout ship armed with a single tractor beam.
Kwilper is a sample character in the book Heroes & Rogues, a book of different character archetypes for use in Star Wars: The Roleplaying Game from West End Games. He is a worked example of the "Squib Trader" template presented in the book. Heroes & Rogues misspells his homeworld as Skorr II.
